name: Turkish Van
details: Depending on the season, the Turkish Van cat has a thick coat of usually white hair, sometimes with orange speckles. Its most characteristic quality is its two-colored eyes that are seen in most cats of the breed.

name: Persian
details: Flat face and long fur: These two characteristics make the Persian cat one of the most instantly recognizable cat breeds of all time. They come in almost all kinds of fur colors

name: Norwegian Forest
details: With their fluffy fur and snowshoe paws, the Norwegian Forest cat is calm in demeanor and equipped to face the harsh colds of northern Europe

name: American shorthair
details: The American Shorthair is a true breed of working cat. The general effect is that of a strongly built, well balanced, symmetrical cat with conformation indicating power, endurance, and agility

name: Abyssinian
details: Coming from Ethiopia, which was formerly known as Abyssinia, this cat is known for its reddish coat and dog-like behavior: following you around and being quite active

name: Ragdoll
details: If you wanted a Siamese but with long hair, it would be a Ragdoll. This breed was given the peculiar name because they go limb when they are lifted up. They are very sweet and docile in demeanor

name: Russian Blue
details: With their shimmering dark grey, silverish fur the Russian Blue has a temperament of its own. While the coat is short it is rather thick.

name: Maine coon
details: Taking their name from the U.S.' Maine, this cat is the biggest breed of them all

name: Scottish Fold
details: Named after their folded ears, the Scottish Fold has big round eyes and are quite rare to come by

name: Bengal
details: The coat of the Bengal is usually warm-colored and speckled with roundish spots. They are quite muscular and rather athletic

name: Siamese
details: This breed comes from Thailand, formerly known as Siam, and has distinct markings usually on their nose, ears, paws and tail

name: Sphynx
details: The lack of fur makes the Sphynx a popular choice for those with allergies. However, due to their sensitivity to cold, this breed requires more care

name: Turkish Angora
details: Sometimes only referred to as Angora or Ankara Cat, this breed has a characteristic long white coat and is said to be quite clever
